intro: Atelophragma rusbyi, commonly known as the African violet, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 centimeters and prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
